intro: Nolana clivicola, commonly known as the cliff dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Nolana clivicola plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and provides nectar for pollinators.
